title: Dry weather likely to prevail across most parts of the country
content:
ISLAMABAD, Oct 17 (APP): The Pakistan Meteorological Department (PMD) on Friday forecast that dry weather was expected to prevail over most parts of the country on Saturday.
Hilly areas are likely to experience cold conditions during morning and night hours.
In Islamabad, the weather will remain dry with clear skies.
In Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, most districts are expected to experience dry conditions, with cold weather in hilly regions during early and late hours.
Across Punjab, dry weather is likely in most areas, including Murree and Galiyat, where the temperature will drop during morning and night hours. In Sindh, the weather will remain hot and dry, particularly in southern parts of the province.
Similarly, Balochistan will experience dry weather in most districts, while northern areas of the province will remain cold during morning and night hours.
Kashmir and Gilgit-Baltistan are also expected to witness dry weather with cold conditions in higher altitudes.
During the past 24 hours, dry weather prevailed across most parts of the country, with cold conditions in hilly regions. The highest maximum temperatures recorded today were 39 C in Mithi, Lasbella, and Chhor.
